instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message: Board came in dead and was drawing 5V, discovered <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and UB400 were very hot, and there was corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7000</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7001</CAPACITOR> and CB214, and they were all replaced. The type-c ammeter was connected to the board and it draws 20V for about 5secs and the type-c ammeter went off, unplugged it and plugged it back, it draws only 5V again, and discovered <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> was very hot again and there was a short on (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL>), when the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> IC was removed the short disappeared, replaced it again, board draws 20V again, the computer was assembled and powered on, it worked pretty well for about 20mins, and it went off, unplugged the ammeter and plugging it back, we tested it with all ports it draws 5V again, and discovered <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and UB300 is getting hot again, 50 degrees C, according to the thermal camera used.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message:
Are you working with original Apple 87/96W charger?
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>/200 and QB300/400 for internal short.

Once get the board working, check L3500 and LB700 voltages; remember to connect an USB device to enable them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>,<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and UB300 were shorted on (PP3V3_UPC__LDO) , i removed them, short gone, i now checked  <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>/200 and QB300/400 for internal short , no internal short. installed another set of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, i got 20v on typec ammeter. the pc is charging and its working , so 
i got 5v on L3500,5v on LB700 respectively after inserting  a usb flash drive, but one out of the 4 ports is not working both sides

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message:
Which port doesn't work properly?
Check and compare diode mode on its CC1/2 lines.
Also remove USB-C connector from the case and check its contacts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message:
the first port by the right  when screen laptop facing me or rather next port after the audio jack port.
there is a short on <SIGNAL>USBC_TA_CC2</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message: Possibly suspects are CB314, DZB501 and UB300.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorting out <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip
threads.message:
i replaced UB300..short gone <SIGNAL>USBC_TA_CC2</SIGNAL>,all the ports are working perfectly well, shortly after that 
 <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> got shorted again on  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL>
